Author: pompompuringdom
Content:
# January 2025
**Muhammadiyah Mining Concessions**
Late January, the government confirmed Muhammadiyah received mining concessions, sparking debates about elite access and state favoring religious organizations.

**Bripda Fauzan Case**
* In mid-January, news broke that Bripda Fauzan, previously on trial for rape, was back on duty after marrying the victim, igniting public outrage over police impunity.
*Indah's addition: Outrage over the normalizationn of rape culture in Indonesia as well*

**MBG Program Launch**
* The Free Nutritious Meal program (MBG) was launched on 6 January, later morphing into one of the year‚Äôs most contentious political issues.

# February 
**#IndonesiaGelap Takes Off**
17‚Äì22 February saw the hashtag #IndonesiaGelap (‚ÄúDark Indonesia‚Äù) trend and national protests erupt. International media framed it as widespread discontent around Prabowo‚Äôs first 100 days ("Most deadly 100 days") 

**LPG 3kg Shortages**
Severe shortages of subsidized LPG sparked long queues and at least one reported death.

**First Cabinet Reshuffle**
* On 19 February, Prabowo conducted his first major cabinet reshuffle, including controversial *stafsus* such as Deddy Corbuzier and Raffi Ahmad. 

**#KaburAjaDulu Emerges**
Online, #KaburAjaDulu (‚ÄúJust Run Away for Now‚Äù) trended among young Indonesians as a cultural response to the economic squeeze and political disillusionment embodied by #IndonesiaGelap.

# March
**Pig‚Äôs Head Threat to Tempo Journalists**
On 19 March, a pig‚Äôs head was sent to Tempo‚Äôs office, widely seen as intimidation of the press and symbolic violence against independent journalism.

**#TolakRUUTNI Protests Peak**
Opposition to a controversial TNI Law revision seen as restoring military ‚Äúdwifungsi.‚Äù On 15 March, activists staged a Fairmont Jakarta occupation of a meeting tied to the bill‚Äôs secretive drafting. Parliament passed the revision on 20 March.

Author: pompompuringdom
Content: @everyonehey can anyone help me check the January Muhammadiyah Mining case for articles reporting on the topic in January? i can't find any on my end, maybe i'm using the wrong keywords?

Author: pompompuringdom
Content: oh and preferably in Indonesian

Author: jaxxxxxxyyyy
Content:
https://www.tempo.co/ekonomi/ormas-keagamaan-hingga-perguruan-tinggi-bisa-terima-konsesi-tambang-muhammadiyah-akui-bersifat-politis-1199604
https://www.bbc.com/indonesia/articles/cy08g9jl42zo

Okok, so there are a few things that I can find here. Bahlil himself admitted that he is going to give Muhammadiyah its own mining place. A few questioned what Muhammadiyah can do or are they competent enough to be able to do the mining management.

Now right after that, there were less news that updated about Muhammadiyah and the mining thingy. But there is one very interesting source that stated that Muhammadiyah until this day, haven't received the mining place yet. 

https://www.cnbcindonesia.com/news/20250722134311-4-651214/muhammadiyah-belum-dapat-tambang-bahlil-buka-suara#:~:text=Jakarta%2C%20CNBC%20Indonesia%20%2D%20Menteri%20Energi,22/7/2025


This means that Muhammadiyah may have received news that they will receive the mines: only for Bahlil to go back into his words as it was quoted from CNBC:

"Bahlil mengatakan tim Kementerian ESDM awalnya telah mendorong Muhammadiyah untuk bisa mengelola wilayah tambang eks Adaro. Namun demikian, setelah dilakukan kajian lokasi tersebut dinilai masih memerlukan pendalaman data."
